questions.more: done deal. An irrevocable agreement, as in Once you've signed the lease, it's a done deal. This slangy expression, first recorded in 1979, may have come from done thing, originating in the late 1600s.

children.search: How do I sell on Done Deal?
children.more: How to place an ad Go to DoneDeal and click on Place ad at the top of the page. Choose the type of ad you want to place - For Sale or Wanted. 3.Upload photos or video. Input your Ad Title - this is the headline of your ad, so be precise. Input your price - it's better to give a price to help people know if it's in their price range. More items...

children.search: How do I remove my ad from done deal?
children.more: Edit/Bump up/Withdraw/Remove/Spotlight Edit (change details of your ad) Bump up (put your ad back to the top of the search results) Withdraw (hide your ad temporarily eg if you're in negotiations with a buyer) Remove (remove it or mark as sold on DoneDeal) Spotlight (in certain sections)

It is never safe to use Western Union®, MoneyGram® or other similar money transfer companies to pay for goods for sale on DoneDeal, regardless of what the other person says. Never buy or sell to a foreign country.

children.search: How do I upload a picture on Done Deal?
children.more: Upload photos Transfer the images from your camera or phone to your computer. Go to DoneDeal and click on the Place ad. Click the "Add Photos/Video" button at the top of the page. Select the photo(s) from your computer (You can upload multiple photos at the same time by holding down the Ctrl key) More items...

questions.search: How old is a classic car in Ireland?
questions.more: The Official Line. Our motor tax laws define a vintage car as one that's 30 or more years old. This interpretation takes us back to 1987 when the Ford Sierra, the Vauxhall Cavalier and the Austin Metro were popular. The Irish Veteran and Vintage Car Club is more specific.Apr 16, 2019

children.search: How old does a car have to be to get classic tax in Ireland?
children.more: Vehicles 30 years old or more qualify for "vintage" motor tax status - a special low rate of €26 per year for motorcycles or €56 per year for all other vehicles. Motor tax can be paid in annual, half-year and quarterly instalments. The tax can be paid online or in person at Motor Tax Offices.
children.parent: How old is a classic car in Ireland?

children.search: How old before a car is a classic?
children.more: The department of motor vehicles (DMV) definition for a classic car differs from state to state. In general, though a classic is any vehicle older than 15 years while an antique is more than 25 years old.Oct 17, 2016
children.parent: How old is a classic car in Ireland?

children.search: What qualifies as a classic car?
children.more: A classic car is an older automobile; the exact definition varies around the world. The common theme is of an older car with enough historical interest to be collectable and worth preserving or restoring rather than scrapping. Cars 20 years and older typically fall into the classic class.
children.parent: How old is a classic car in Ireland?
